page.description: Visits all records and dumps field name + space used.
page.original:
&ltTBL>.FIELD_SPACE_USAGE() Syntax Field_List as C = &ltTBL>.FIELD_SPACE_USAGE() ArgumentDescription Field_ListA CR-LF delimited string in the format &ltfieldname>, width, decimals.
Description The &ltTBL>.FIELD_SPACE_USAGE() method scans all of the data in a table and reports the minimum size needed for each field. For example, if you have defined a character field with a size of 100 but none of the records in this field is longer than 40, then you can safely restructure your table and reduce this field to 40 characters. Note : The function returns 0 for the width of memo fields. Example This script was attached to a button on a form. dim tbl as P dim answer as C tbl = table.current() answer = tbl.field_space_usage() ui_msg_box("Minimum Size for Each Field", answer)
See Also Table Functions and Methods
